snippet: The prime minister said that threats posed by bad local government debt and soaring real estate prices were under control, and that the economy was robust.
abstract: China's Prime Min Wen Jiabao opens new session of the National People's Congress by saying that threats posed by bad local government debt and soaring real estate prices are under firm state control and that the economy is robust.

byline.contributor: Sharon LaFraniere contributed reporting, and Li Bibo and Edy Yin contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The prime minister said that threats posed by bad local government debt and soaring real estate prices were under control, and that the economy was robust.

headline.seo: Chinese Premier Offers Upbeat Assessment of Economy
headline.main: Chinese Congress Opens With Upbeat Economic Assessments, and Eyes on the Top
headline.print_headline: Chinese Congress Opens With Upbeat Economic Assessments, and Eyes on the Top
